Gold prices hit all-time high of Rs 1.05 lakh per 10g
description: Gold prices soared to a record high of Rs 1,05,670 per 10 grams in the national capital, marking the sixth consecutive session of gains. The surge was fueled by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut and strong overseas demand. Silver prices also reached a new peak of Rs 1,26,000 per kilogram, driven by industrial demand and speculative interest.

‘Weapons’, ‘Sinners’, and the rise of absurdist horror in a broken world
Watch: What's key to success in politics? Gadkari's unique advise
description: Union minister Nitin Gadkari stated that honesty is challenging in politics, where deception can lead to leadership. Speaking at an event, he emphasized the importance of truth, non-violence, peace, humanity, and equality, drawing inspiration from Chakradhar Swami's teachings. Gadkari also highlighted the significance of values like honesty and dedication in society.

title: SC notice to Centre on PIL seeking transgender-inclusive school textbooks

Himachal Pradesh records highest rainfall in August since 1949, rain to continue in September
Army removes TMC stage: Mamata sees red; BJP says Bengal CM 'frustrated'
description: The Army dismantled a Trinamool Congress stage in Kolkata's Maidan, citing a violation of permit regulations regarding the duration of events in the area. Mamata Banerjee criticized the BJP, accusing them of using the Army, while urging the forces to remain neutral. TMC alleges political targeting and plans to relocate the protest.

title: Adhyayan Suman speaks about being vulnerable, expressing emotions: ‘Can show my manliness in many other ways’
Women’s Cricket World Cup champs to earn more than Pat Cummins’ Australia that won men’s CWC 2023
'Blatant interference by Russia': EU chief's plane hit by GPS jamming
description: Ursula von der Leyen's plane faced suspected Russian GPS jamming during landing in Bulgaria. Bulgarian authorities suspect Russian interference. The plane landed safely at Plovdiv International Airport. Von der Leyen was visiting Bulgaria as part of a tour. The region is vulnerable to "Russian hybrid threats."

title: New low-pressure area developing in Bay of Bengal, Mumbai expected to receive heavy rainfall later this week
India vs Iran CAFA Nations Cup 2025 Highlights: India’s dogged defence buckles to Iran’s superstars
NEET: SC upholds Telangana’s domicile rules for admissions in medical colleges under state quota
Supreme Court dismisses PIL challenging E20 petrol policy and seeking ethanol-free petrol option
'Brahmins profiteering': Trump adviser's remark on Russian oil trade sparks outrage
description: White House trade counselor Peter Navarro ignited controversy by accusing "Brahmins" of profiting from refined Russian oil sales to the West, escalating US-India trade tensions. His remarks, following accusations of India being a "laundromat for Kremlin," sparked outrage and were deemed inflammatory.

title: Archana Puran Singh taught both sons to be vegetarians, Aaryamann says can’t even kill a mosquito: ‘I let them bite me; I say a prayer if…’
60-year-old Bengaluru man arrested for setting fire to former live-in partner; woman succumbs to injuries
‘How will devotees come? Roads are blocked’: Maratha quota protest hits Ganesh Mandal darshans in South Mumbai
At least 800 dead, over 2,500 injured: All you need to know about Afghanistan earthquake
'I feel ashamed': Harbhajan on slapping Sreesanth; calls Lalit Modi 'selfish'
description: Lalit Modi stirred controversy by sharing an old video of the infamous IPL 'slapgate' incident between Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth. Harbhajan expressed his disappointment, suggesting a selfish motive behind resurfacing the 18-year-old incident. He acknowledged his mistake, reiterated his regret, and mentioned seeking forgiveness.

title: ‘Read the judgement and then speak’: Facing Amit Shah heat on Salwa Judum judgement, INDIA bloc’s V-P candidate Sudershan Reddy responds

An exhibition at New York’s Metropolitan Museum of Art celebrates Ganesha as the ‘Lord of New Beginnings’
US Embassy hails ‘enduring friendship’ with India as Modi meets Putin, Xi Jinping at SCO Summit
FIDE CEO slams Hikaru's claims of Carlsen Candidates favouritism
description: FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky refuted Hikaru Nakamura's claims that the Candidates' rating qualification spot was designed for Magnus Carlsen's potential return. Sutovsky clarified that the rule has existed for years and now benefits top players like Nakamura. He emphasised the spot ensures the inclusion of the world's best, not specifically targeting Carlsen, whose return is deemed unlikely.

title: Bangladesh vs Netherlands Live Score Streaming, 2nd T20I: When and where to watch BAN vs NED match today?

Flood warning for Delhi: Yamuna expected to cross danger mark by tomorrow evening
Why couples are ditching real flowers for eco-friendly crochet varmalas
Trump rattled? US tries to cosy up to India as PM Modi meets Putin, Xi
description: The US Embassy in India affirmed the strong US-India ties, highlighting it as a defining relationship of the 21st century. Despite this positive outlook, trade tensions persist due to recent tariffs imposed by the US, citing trade deficits and India's Russian oil purchases.

title: GST collections hit Rs 1.86L cr; 6.5% increase YoY
description: Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections demonstrated a 6.5% year-over-year increase in August, reaching Rs 1.86 lakh crore, as per official government data. The preceding month saw even higher gross GST collections, totaling Rs 1.96 lakh crore.

title: 'Habit of chori': Kharge targets PM Modi - predicts end of NDA rule soon
description: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of attempting to steal votes in the upcoming Bihar assembly elections. He asserted that the NDA's double-engine government would soon be ousted, replaced by a government representing the poor, backward communities, and Dalits. Kharge also criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's alliance with the BJP-RSS, questioning his socialist principles.

title: Thousands attend funeral of Houthi leaders killed by Israeli strike, vow revenge
'Hydrogen bomb soon': Rahul hints new expose on 'vote chori'; BJP reacts
description: Rahul Gandhi, leader of opposition, has accused the BJP of "vote chori" and promised a new exposé, a "hydrogen bomb," following claims of similar electoral malpractices in Mahadevpura. He asserted that PM Modi would be unable to face the public after this revelation.

title: Why Jagdeep Dhankhar is at home in INLD chief Abhay Chautala’s farmhouse
Night to remember! Rinku finally talks about that unforgettable 5-six finish
description: Rinku Singh's five consecutive sixes in IPL 2023 against Gujarat Titans catapulted him to fame, significantly raising expectations and earning him immense love. He acknowledges the match gave him a unique identity, not just personally but for India. His consistent performance has secured him a place in India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, where they will face UAE, Pakistan and Oman.

title: What role does De Villiers want the ‘professor’ of cricket Ashwin to play?
OTT Releases This Week: From Inspector Zende to Highest 2 Lowest, here’s what to watch on Netflix, JioHotstar, Amazon Prime Video
Salesforce cuts 4,000 jobs: AI replace half of support staff; CEO flip-flops
description: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff announced a significant reduction of 4,000 customer support positions, a 45% decrease, as AI agents now handle 50% of customer interactions. This shift contrasts with Benioff's July statements, where he downplayed AI's potential for mass unemployment. The company is also utilising AI to address a backlog of over 100 million uncalled sales leads.

title: ‘Dentist’ Dhanashree Verma treated Ranbir Kapoor while practising medicine, Farah Khan asks ‘Was his mouth different?’: ‘Quite healthy, good hygiene’
Indian Railways ticket booking: What is the total number of tickets booked via IRCTC in Q1FY26?
'Was never desperate to play for India before': Karthik lauds youngster
description: Dinesh Karthik praises Jitesh Sharma's mindset regarding national team selection. Karthik helped Jitesh refine his finishing skills while at Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Jitesh's IPL 2025 performance earned him a spot back on the Indian squad. He aims to solidify his position in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. Sanju Samson is currently the preferred wicketkeeper.

title: ‘Lokah Chapter 1 is best Indian film in the last few years’: Sanjay Gupta heaps praise; Priyadarshan says daughter Kalyani ‘doesn’t tell me about her projects’
Stigma for rape has to be on accused, change in societal mindset needed: Delhi High Court

Two months ago, rain washed away a bridge in Uttarakhand. For residents on the other side, life is on hold

Mumbai Maratha protests: commuters face traffic congestion and hold-ups as agitators congregate around CSMT
'Not for the ears of others': When Putin offered a lift to 'dear friend' PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin engaged in an extended private discussion on Monday, taking place within Putin's Aurus limousine following the SCO summit. According to PTI reports, Putin offered Modi a ride, using the opportunity to continue their one-on-one talks for nearly an hour before their scheduled formal bilateral meeting.

title: Eggs hurled at Ganesh idol: 3 arrested from Ajmer, including ‘admin’ of social media group ‘Mafia Gang’
Why Manoj Jarange Patil is upset with two Mahayuti ministers and vows to target them
Sunil Dutt called Suniel Shetty when he and Sanjay Dutt almost campaigned for his opponent, said ‘mera to socho’: ‘Your son didn’t think of you’
Polish CEO row: US Open incident sparks outrage; company Drogbruk faces review-bombing
description: A video of Polish businessman Piotr Szczerek grabbing a signed cap intended for a young fan at the US Open sparked widespread outrage. The incident led to a review-bombing campaign against Szczerek's company, Drogbruk, severely damaging its online reputation.

title: Karnataka HC refuses to hear PIL seeking station at Chikkajala on Bengaluru Metro’s Blue Line
‘Virat Kohli went to Australia and didn’t know what to do before retirement’: Joe Root could face similar test in Ashes 2025, says ex-England bowler
Coal faces GST uncertainty as compensation cess may end early
India reduces US Treasury bill holdings! Gold up in forex reserves; check details
description: India is increasingly favoring gold over US Treasury bills to bolster its foreign exchange reserves, mirroring a global trend of diversifying away from dollar-denominated assets. While India's US T-bill holdings decreased to $227 billion in June 2025, its gold reserves rose significantly to 879.98 metric tonnes.

title: Badminton and Kabaddi have lot of commonalities, says Pullela Gopichand
Pune Crime Files | From aspiring dancer to cyber fugitive: how a con woman who fled from a train was caught on a Bihar farm
Bihar SIR: SC says confusion over exercise 'largely trust issue'
Bengaluru man chases live-in partner’s car, douses her in petrol; sets her ablaze
description: In Bengaluru, a 35-year-old woman, Vanajakshi, tragically died after her live-in partner, Vithal, allegedly set her on fire following a history of domestic disputes. Vithal, a cab driver, was arrested after he intercepted a car Vanajakshi was traveling in, pouring petrol on her and the other occupants at a traffic signal.

title: Who is CEO Piotr Szczerek? Man who went viral for snatching a signed cap from kid
description: A viral video from the US Open shows Piotr Szczerek, CEO of Drogbruk, snatching a signed cap intended for a child, sparking global outrage. Social media users identified Szczerek, leading to a barrage of negative reviews for his company. Tennis player Kamil Majchrzak gifted the young fan, Brok, another signed cap.

title: Over 800 dead, thousands injured in Afghanistan quake; villages flattened
description: A devastating magnitude 6 earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border on Sunday, resulting in a tragic loss of over 800 lives and leaving approximately 2,500 individuals injured. The powerful tremors caused widespread destruction, leveling numerous villages and buildings in the affected region. Rescue operations are currently underway, with medical teams dispatched from neighbouring provinces and Kabul to provide assistance.

title: 'Bid to flare tensions': BJP slams Trump aide Navarro's casteist jab
description: Peter Navarro accused India of indirectly funding Russia's war in Ukraine through discounted oil purchases, alleging that Brahmins are profiting at the expense of the Indian people. He criticized India's high tariffs, claiming they hurt American workers and taxpayers while indirectly funding the Russian war machine. Navarro also expressed optimism about trade negotiations with China.

title: Parenting choice: Melinda Gates on picking her daughter’s school
description: Melinda French Gates revealed that Bill Gates, despite his demanding role as Microsoft CEO, made time to drive their eldest daughter to preschool daily. This decision, initially a family negotiation, surprisingly inspired other parents to share domestic responsibilities more equitably. The car rides became cherished moments for Bill and his children, highlighting the importance of balancing work and family.

title: Shedeur Sanders’ private message to Deion after loss inspires
description: Colorado Buffaloes faced a narrow defeat against Georgia Tech. The defense struggled, giving up significant rushing yards. Coach Deion Sanders remained optimistic despite the setback. His son, Shedeur Sanders, sent a rallying cry to the family. He emphasized the need to regroup and uphold the Sanders legacy. Colorado prepares to face Nebraska next.

title: NFL star Russell Wilson and wife turn US Open into a family celebration
description: Ciara and Russell Wilson charmed onlookers at the US Open, blending family time with superstar glamour. Their children, Future Zahir and Sienna Princess, added to the heartwarming scene. Beyond the courts, their Why Not You Foundation hosted a fundraiser at MetLife Stadium, aiming to raise $3 million for youth and families.

title: George Pickens: Micah Parsons’ Packers trade was ‘good for me’
description: In a stunning NFL trade, the Dallas Cowboys sent star edge rusher Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers for two first-round picks and Kenny Clark. Parsons promptly signed a record-breaking $188 million extension with Green Bay, becoming the highest-paid non-quarterback.

title: Chargers vs Chiefs YouTube coverage: ESPN bans Jason Kelce
description: YouTube's pursuit of Jason Kelce for its exclusive Chargers-Chiefs broadcast in Brazil was thwarted by ESPN. Kelce, now an ESPN analyst, is restricted from appearing on competitor platforms like YouTube due to a new company policy. This decision marks a shift from last season, as ESPN tightens control over its on-air talent amid the rise of streaming in live sports.

title: AI restructure at Meta: Wang’s memo to staff makes one thing clear - all report to him
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

title: Jack Brady skips Gisele for special outing with mom Bridget Moynahan
description: Bridget Moynahan and her son Jack were spotted at the US Open, continuing their tradition at Arthur Ashe Stadium. This appearance followed Tom Brady's heartfelt social media tribute to Jack on his 18th birthday, highlighting their strong father-son bond. Despite Brady and Moynahan's past relationship, they maintain a respectful co-parenting dynamic, prioritizing their children's well-being.
